name: Lighthouse
tagline: A simple jquery plugin to expand and adapt content
body: ### Lighthouse Lighthouse is a simple jquery plugin that allows content to expand or adapt to the user's needs. It is very basic and simple in order to allow maximum compatibility and customizability. Feel free to fork and suggest changes. ## Three steps! **Sample HTML** ``` Caption ``` **Add the css** ``` ``` **Add the script (after jquery and jqueryui are loaded)** ``` ``` **Use it!** ``` ``` ## Options Lighthouse supports setting custom options in the following syntax: ``` $('.lighthouse').lighthouse({ option1: 'value1', option2: 'value2' }); ``` ### Defaults **How to find the container** ``` containerSelector: '.lighthouse' ``` **How to find the thumbnail anchor** ``` anchorSelector: 'a' ``` **How to find the thumbnail** ``` imageSelector: 'img' ``` **How to find the child container (not needed if contentType is image)** ``` childSelector: '.content' ``` **How to find the child anchor (not needed if contentType is image)** ``` childAnchorSelector: 'a' ``` **How to find the child image (not needed if contentType is image)** ``` childImageSelector: 'img' ``` **What the class of the close anchor will be** ``` closeSelector: '.close' ``` **What the class of the background div will be** ``` backgroundSelector: '.background' ``` **Sets both the open and close duration** ``` duration: 350 ``` **Sets how long the open animation lasts** ``` openDuration: null ``` **Sets how long the close animation lasts** ``` closeDuration: null ``` **Sets how long any other animation lasts (background/close button/content fade in/out)** ``` secondaryDuration: 200 ``` **What type of content determines whether or not a child div named content will be created (ie if it is an image then a special div will be created)** ``` contentType: 'image' ```
